title: Ticket #3755: Add GAHP command to detect EC2 server type
description:
Most cloud services that speak EC2 don't implement the full EC2 protocol. In some cases, this affects how HTCondor needs to interact with the server. See #3682 for the motivating reason for this ticket. If at all possible, we shouldn't require the user to tell us what cloud service type each resource is. HTCondor should try to determine that automatically.

Fortunately, the response to a simple EC2 query contains enough information to determine which cloud service type it comes from. We should add a new EC2 GAHP command that does this. The gridmanager can then modify its interactions with the server accordingly.
